intro: Securidaca froesii, commonly known as the Cape York securidaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Securidaca froesii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
